results.title: Speaking of Mary
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Annie Bolitho and ACMI
results.brief_description: Annie Bolitho tells of some of the questions that trouble her in her job as a funeral celebrant. How well does she know the person she’s remembering. It makes her wonder how well she knew her mother. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.

results.title: Ada's story
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ada Peterson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ada Peterson and ACMI

results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Terry Melvin and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Terry Melvin and ACMI

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Brearley and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Brearley and ACMI
results.description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI

results.title: The Parachute workers
results.creator_credit: Peg Osborne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being discouraged, Peg Osborne wanted to contribute to Australia’s World War II effort. She joined the air force and was sent to Bairnsdale as a textile worker. She reflects on her time there, the work, relations with the male workers, and the sorrows as well as the humour that keep everyone’s spirits up and the friends that Peg will never forget.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peg Osborne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being discouraged, Peg Osborne wanted to contribute to Australia’s World War II effort. She joined the air force and was sent to Bairnsdale as a textile worker. She reflects on her time there, the work, relations with the male workers, and the sorrows as well as the humour that keep everyone’s spirits up and the friends that Peg will never forget.

results.title: The Traveller
results.creator_credit: John Hansen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: John Hansen’s war experience really started after World War II. Having been seconded into the US Navy, John was there to celebrate in the streets of California when the war ended. Then he travelled the world, transporting a variety of things, from war brides to coal. In the end, the world became his classroom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hansen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

Then he travelled the world, transporting a variety of things, from war brides to coal. In the end, the world became his classroom.
